Describe the bug
 The interactive window is not responding when many geometries (>=400) are visualized.
 To Reproduce
 Steps to reproduce the behavior:
 import open3d as o3d
 import numpy as np
 
 points = np.random.uniform(-1.0, 1.0, size=[100000, 3])
 boxes = np.random.uniform(0, 1, size=[400, 6])
 pc = o3d.geometry.PointCloud()
 pc.points = o3d.utility.Vector3dVector(points)
 geometries = [pc]
 for box in boxes:
     abb = o3d.geometry.AxisAlignedBoundingBox(box[0:3] - box[3:6] * 0.5, box[0:3] + box[3:6] * 0.5)
     geometries.append(abb)
 o3d.visualization.draw_geometries(geometries)
 Environment (please complete the following information):
 
 Operating system: Ubuntu 18.04
 Python version: e.g. Python 3.7
 Open3D version: 10.0
 Is this remote workstation?: no
 How did you install Open3D?: pip

comments_0.comment_text:
A very unfortunate and incorrect merge conflict resolution some time ago left us adding n^2 geometries. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/intel-isl/Open3D/pull/2523>#2523</denchmark-link>
  restores back to the requested number of geometries, which fixes this issue.
